channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Grok thinks Musk more handsome than Brad Pitt. Can the chatbot be trusted?
Who is Deepak Chopra, the Indian-American named in Epstein files? What do the emails reveal?
You’ve heard of Fomo, but what about Fofo? It’s the Fear of Finding Out
Trump-Mamdani meet: Will US president say in public what he privately thinks of NYC mayor-elect?
Why a carbonara sauce in European Parliament has stirred Italian outrage
Inside the 7km-long Gaza tunnel where Hamas kept Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin’s body for over 11 years
Isolation of Alliance of Sahel States fuels Islamist insurgency in the region
item.description: The future of the AES depends on how well it tackles governance and security-related challenges, and for that it needs Ecowas as well as the Western world

item.title: UN endorsing Trump’s Gaza plan is a good start, but peace requires more than ceasefire
item.description: Approval by the UN Security Council means Trump’s Gaza plan is now effective, making him the new czar in West Asia; however, only an enduring peace will decide his prospects of winning the Nobel Peace Prize

item.title: Bangladesh follows Pakistan template, targeting Ahmadiyyas after Hindus
item.description: In the journey towards a Sharia-governed state, highly regressive regulations to persecute women and minorities are likely to follow

item.title: Putin’s upcoming India visit: Delhi and Moscow recalibrate ties amid global turbulence
item.description: This will be Russian President Vladimir Putin’s first visit to India since the Ukraine invasion in February 2022, underscoring its importance

item.title: Amit Shah’s red book: How it engineered the Maoists’ fall and could be a blueprint for ending future insurgencies
item.description: The Modi government’s unprecedented successes against Left-Wing Extremism have shown that insurgencies cannot be fought through development rhetoric alone. They require firm state authority, followed by inclusive development that empowers marginalised communities.

item.title: Exile, extradition and erosion of democracy in Bangladesh: The politics behind Sheikh Hasina’s death sentence
item.description: The recycling of the issues about Sheikh Hasina is engineered to conceal Muhammad Yunus’ incompetence and failure
